Node.definition: = title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

= state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community|literally: only one; hence: = state in which humans or objects are considered unique and therefore entitled to special care and affection
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to turn (one's) heart (in a certain direction)|to focus (one's) attention
Node.definition: literally: to turn (from something); hence: = action by which humans stop focusing their thoughts and attention on a certain activity
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= point in time at which an event starts happening
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= object that is acquired, whether by means of a financial transaction or in another way
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action by which humans express their respect to (other) humans or deities
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant an elevated status to humans in the eyes of other people
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love making

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
possible meaning: = flowers or leaves woven together into a ring; ► worn on one's head; ≈ associated with honor and beauty
= state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= action by which humans transfer possession of something to someone else
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities give instructions to (other) humans with respect to a certain aspect of life, ◄ as if they take them by the hand and lead them along the way
= pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to be hindered|to be impeded|to be restricted
Node.definition: = state in which an event cannot take place in exactly the way it is intended because of something that hinders it
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

Node.gloss: to hold on to|to devote oneself to|to persist in|to retain|to obtain
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities are actively involved in a certain event

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to follow the way (of)|to act (with, as)
Node.definition: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= action by which humans proceed along their way in a different direction than before
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to cause to stumble|to cause to fail
Node.definition: literally: to cause to stumble; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans not to live up to the expectations others have of them
= action by which humans ingest food
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light
= process by which events continue over a prolonged period of time, ◄ described as movement along time
see אֹור (אֹור)
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which a process has come to completion
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans keep processing information in their minds
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: outlet; hence: = the location from which a certain process originates

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: crookedness (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= state in which an event lacks integrity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: eyelids; hence: = a poetic reference to the eye (עַיִן)
literally: to make straight one's eyelids; = action by which humans look forward without being distracted by things visible on the left or on the right
= pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: (one's) ways are established; hence: = state in which someone's activities are faithful and in line with God's will
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
